function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Focus on human contact with natural systems and processes in the built environment could lead to the spread of contagious diseases through exposure to natural elements.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious disease transmission in the built environment, negatively impacting public health and wellbeing.","Mitigation":"Implementing stringent hygiene and sanitation protocols, promoting awareness of disease transmission risks, and integrating technology for air filtration and purification.","Technologies":"Air filtration and purification systems, UV disinfection technology, smart sensors for monitoring environmental conditions.","People":"Occupants of built environments, including residents, workers, and visitors.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"The theory of biophilia and the instinctive human need for contact with nature may lead to a greater likelihood of exposure to infectious agents present in natural elements.","Impact":"Increased susceptibility to infectious diseases and potential illness among individuals seeking contact with natural elements.","Mitigation":"Education on safe interaction with natural elements, regular health screenings, and implementation of protective measures such as personal protective equipment (PPE).","Technologies":"Biometric screening technology, remote health monitoring devices, wearable PPE innovations.","People":"Individuals with a strong desire for contact with natural elements, environmental designers, health professionals.","Owner":"Health organizations, educational institutions, environmental design firms."}]}
